attributes.action: stop Weston Favell School in Northampton from becoming an Academy in September 2009
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
For the last four years Weston Favell School has suffered a series of disruptions:

• we have changed from a 3 tier to a 2 tier system, 
• we have been on a split site because of this, the GCSE students have been on a construction and destruction site, 
• we’ve had additional disruption from moving site and the teething problems, 
• we had a period without a permanent head and the new head has not been given enough time to show the result of the hard work we’ve all put in. 

Therefore we oppose Academy Status at this time because:
• it will bring more disruption
• it will cause some staff to leave because of ULT’s employment record
• it is the Privatisation of education and means that the academy will not be accountable to parents, staff, students or elected bodies.
• Some Academies have corporate partnerships which result in school departments advertising private corporations

If the proposed sponsor gets the contract they’ll achieve a monopoly on Northants Secondaries, reducing parental choice.
